newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Yields fall on Bulgaria 6-, 9-mth floater T-bills.
newsitem.headline: Yields fall on Bulgaria 6-, 9-mth floater T-bills.

text.p: Yields fell at Monday's auctions of Bulgaria's floating interest six- and nine-month T-bills due to a cut in the main interest rate, central bank figures showed.
The average yields to maturity on the two issues were 24.58 and 39.16 percent, down from 26.91 and 41.56 percent at the respective auctions a week earlier.
The average accepted prices for the two issues auctioned on Monday were 99.19 and 97.27 percent of par compared to 97.94 and 96.38 percent for the two respective maturities auctioned on June 2.
Interest on the issues is due at maturity. It is set equal to the central bank main interest rate for each of the issues and is adjusted every time the main rate is changed.
A cut in the central bank main interest rate to 47.28 percent annually from 48.72 percent became effective on Monday.
Details of the issues follow. Prices in percent of par:
Par value 10,000 million levs 5,000 million levs
Bids received 50,990.3 million levs 12,300 million levs
Average price of bids 98.67 pct 96.98 pct
Bids approved 10,000 million levs 5,000 million levs
Average yield to maturity 24.58 pct 39.16 pct
